Q12: We have reviewed all manager assessments of employees, looking at the gender of the manager and the gender of the employee. Overall, we saw that there were little differences across gender in the assessment - when comparing to the company averages. Most notably, it was women managers who tend to assess their women employees slightly lower than the company average. Whereas men managers assessed their women employees at the same rate as the company average, or slightly higher than the company average.
